definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Trend traders use an initial risk rule that determines position size at the time of entry.
sentences.chinese: 趨勢交易者買進伊始，便設立最初的止盈和止損位置。

sentences.english: One recent story profiled a twenty-seven-year-old trader from Goldman Sachs.
sentences.chinese: 最近有人提到了一個來自高盛集團的27歲的交易者。

sentences.english: So, traders should consider sell into counter-trend bounces.
sentences.chinese: 因此交易者應考慮逢高拋售。

sentences.english: This other kind of price movement is based more on short-term information known to a few trader groups.
sentences.chinese: 這就是少數交易者知道的信息改變了價格的波動。

sentences.english: After all, traders in Shanghai still are prone to extravagant mood swings.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，上海的交易者仍有過度受情緒擺佈的傾向。

sentences.english: These charts show how one trader makes his buy and sell decisions.
sentences.chinese: 這些圖表明瞭交易者如何如何做買賣決定。

sentences.english: So, traders should wait to sell into market rallies rather than chasing prices down.
sentences.chinese: 因此，交易者應等待時機逢高賣出而非殺跌。

sentences.english: But the dollar seesawed and was little changed against the euro, the currency pairing most oil traders focus on.
sentences.chinese: 大多數原油交易者關注的美元兌歐元的上下波動較小。

sentences.english: A trader who takes a position in the market and might hold that position over a long period of time.
sentences.chinese: 在市場裏擁有交易盤口的交易者並且可能會長期持有。

sentences.english: Most traders look at charts, but very few look at themselves.
sentences.chinese: 很多交易者愛看圖，很少有人愛看自己的圖。

sentences.english: Market timing attempts to predict the direction of future market movements in order to buy low and sell high.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的目標是低買高賣，那麼你就是擇時交易者。

sentences.english: The market seduces traders into breaking their rules.
sentences.chinese: 市場引誘交易者們打破自己的原則。

sentences.english: The Turtles were trained to be trend-following traders.
sentences.chinese: 海龜們被訓練成趨勢跟蹤交易者。

sentences.english: Other trend-following traders were doing well at the time.
sentences.chinese: 當時，其他趨勢跟蹤交易者都做的很好。

sentences.english: There is no magic trick for converting a serious amateur into a professional trader.
sentences.chinese: 沒有任何魔術可以把業餘選手變成專業交易者。

sentences.english: On a screen, they see the other traders are offering to sell or buy at.
sentences.chinese: 在一個屏幕上，他們看到其他交易者提供出售或購買。

definition: stop-loss point, a point at which you make a small loss to limit your losses
to invest in stock/to buy shares
